lead_paragraph: For many Cuban-Americans, still bitter over the revolution that tore their families from their homes, it was a celebration long in coming.

byline.contributor: Neil Reisner and Frances Robles contributed reporting.

headline.print_headline: Miami’s Streets Fill With Songs and Reflection
headline.main: Miami’s Cuban Exiles Celebrate Castro’s Death

snippet: For many Cuban-Americans, still bitter over the revolution that tore their families from their homes, it was a celebration long in coming....
abstract: Cuban-American residents of Miami celebrate death of Fidel Castro, former Cuban president who prompted many to flee their home country and settle in America; Cuban exiles were instrumental in swaying United States away from Castro and supporting trade embargo, and many in younger generation, while less hard-line than their parents, still oppose Castro.
